content.text:
---
**SOCIALAIZE-SPECIFIC VERSION**
Updated: October 22, 2025
This workflow uses Socialaize stack - see SOCIALAIZE_UI_SYSTEM_v3.md for tech details
Part 1 Status: âœ… Complete (Tailwind config enhanced)
---

# UI Batch Component Update

Apply consistent changes across multiple components with real-time progress tracking and quality validation.

## Usage

```bash
/ui-batch-update buttons/* Update all buttons to use new --color-primary-600 token
/ui-batch-update cards/* Add loading state prop to all card components
/ui-batch-update **/*.vue Convert all inline styles to Tailwind classes
```

**Syntax**: `/ui-batch-update [pattern] [change description]`

## Process

Apply changes to components matching: `$1`
Change to make: `src/components/{BenefitsSection,AdvancedFeaturesSection,FooterSection,PricingSection}.vue Migrate to enterprise design system: apply design-system.css tokens (--color-*, --spacing-*, --radius-*, --shadow-*), components.css base classes (.card, .button, .badge), utilities.css custom utilities (glass-*, focus-ring-*, animate-*), and typography.css responsive fonts. Maintain component functionality while upgrading visual design to match enterprise standards.` (excluding first argument)

### Step 1: Discovery
1. Find all components matching pattern
2. Count total components to update
3. Show list for user approval
4. **WAIT FOR CONFIRMATION** before proceeding

### Step 2: Analysis (ui-analyzer)
For each component:
1. Read current implementation
2. Identify required changes
3. Check for conflicts
4. Plan modification approach

### Step 3: Batch Update (ui-builder)
For each component:
1. Apply changes systematically
2. Maintain consistency across all files
3. Preserve existing functionality
4. Update TypeScript types as needed
5. Show progress: [X/N] Component updated

### Step 4: Validation (ui-validator)
For each updated component:
1. Quality score check
2. Design system compliance
3. Accessibility validation
4. Auto-fix common issues
5. Report issues if score < 85/100

### Step 5: Visual Regression (ui-validator)
If visual changes detected:
1. Capture screenshots of all updated components
2. Compare against baselines
3. Flag significant visual differences
4. Require approval for baseline updates

### Step 6: Final Report
1. Show summary of all changes
2. Report quality metrics
3. List any issues found
4. Provide next steps

## Output Format

```markdown
# ðŸ”„ Batch Update: [Pattern]

**Target**: $1
**Change**: [Change description]

---

## ðŸ“‹ Discovery

### Components Found: [N]
\```
src/components/vue/buttons/PrimaryButton.vue
src/components/vue/buttons/SecondaryButton.vue
src/components/vue/buttons/IconButton.vue
[... list all components]
\```

**Proceed with batch update?** (yes/no)

---

## ðŸ”„ Batch Update Progress

### Component 1/N: PrimaryButton.vue â³
**Status**: Analyzing...
**Changes**: Identified 3 modifications needed

**Status**: Updating... 
**Changes Applied**:
- âœ… Updated color token
- âœ… Added new prop
- âœ… Updated TypeScript types

**Status**: Validating...
**Quality Score**: 96/100 âœ…

---

### Component 2/N: SecondaryButton.vue â³
[Same progress format]

---

### Component 3/N: IconButton.vue â³
[Continue for all components]

---

## âœ… Batch Update Complete

**Summary:**
- **Total Components**: [N]
- **Successfully Updated**: [X]
- **Failed**: [Y]
- **Average Quality Score**: 94/100
- **Time Taken**: 15 minutes

---

## ðŸ“Š Quality Report

| Component | Before | After | Change | Issues |
|-----------|--------|-------|--------|--------|
| PrimaryButton.vue | 92/100 | 96/100 | +4 | None |
| SecondaryButton.vue | 88/100 | 94/100 | +6 | 1 warning |
| IconButton.vue | 85/100 | 91/100 | +6 | Auto-fixed |

**Overall Impact**: +5.3 average score improvement

---

## ðŸ” Issues Found

### Component: SecondaryButton.vue
**Issue**: Color contrast slightly below WCAG AA
**Severity**: âš ï¸ Warning
**Fix**: Adjust --color-secondary-600 for better contrast

[List any other issues]

---

## ðŸ¤– Auto-Fixed Issues

Automatically corrected across all components:

1. **Missing TypeScript types** (3 components)
   - Added proper interface definitions
   
2. **Hardcoded spacing** (2 components)
   - Converted to Tailwind utilities

3. **Inconsistent naming** (1 component)
   - Standardized prop names

---

## ðŸ“¸ Visual Changes Detected

**Components with visual changes**: 3/[N]

### PrimaryButton.vue
![Before](screenshots/baselines/PrimaryButton-before.png)
![After](screenshots/PrimaryButton-after.png)
**Diff**: 2.3% pixel change (acceptable)

### SecondaryButton.vue  
![Before](screenshots/baselines/SecondaryButton-before.png)
![After](screenshots/SecondaryButton-after.png)
**Diff**: 15.7% pixel change âš ï¸ (review required)

---

## ðŸŽ¯ Action Items

### Immediate:
1. [ ] Review SecondaryButton visual changes (15.7% diff)
2. [ ] Fix color contrast issue in SecondaryButton

### Follow-up:
1. [ ] Update component documentation
2. [ ] Update visual regression baselines if changes approved
3. [ ] Deploy to staging for testing

---

## ðŸš€ Next Steps

**If all changes look good:**
```bash
# Update baselines for visual regression
/ui-visual-regression --update-baselines
```

**To document changes:**
```bash
# Update documentation for modified components
/ui-document [pattern]
```

**To rollback if needed:**
```bash
git checkout HEAD -- [file-list]
```

---

## ðŸ“ˆ Comparison

**Before Batch Update:**
- Average Score: 88.3/100
- Token Compliance: 87%
- A11y Issues: 5

**After Batch Update:**
- Average Score: 93.6/100 (+5.3)
- Token Compliance: 100% (+13%)
- A11y Issues: 1 (-4)

**Success Rate**: 94% (X/N components improved)
\```

## Batch Update Strategies

### Strategy 1: Token Migration
Update design tokens across multiple components:
- Search: All color values
- Replace: With CSS custom properties
- Validate: 100% token compliance

### Strategy 2: API Changes
Add/remove props consistently:
- Identify: All affected components
- Update: Prop interfaces
- Validate: TypeScript compilation

### Strategy 3: Accessibility Improvements
Enhance a11y across component set:
- Add: ARIA labels
- Improve: Keyboard navigation
- Validate: WCAG compliance

### Strategy 4: Performance Optimization
Apply optimizations systematically:
- Add: v-memo directives
- Optimize: Computed properties
- Validate: Performance metrics

## Safety Features

### Pre-Update Checks
âœ… Backup current state (git status check)
âœ… Component count confirmation
âœ… Change description review
âœ… User approval required

### During Update
âœ… Individual component validation
âœ… Real-time progress tracking
âœ… Auto-fix application
âœ… Error recovery

### Post-Update
âœ… Comprehensive quality report
âœ… Visual regression testing
âœ… Issue documentation
âœ… Rollback instructions

## Progress Tracking

Real-time progress indicators:

```
[1/10] âœ… PrimaryButton.vue (96/100)
[2/10] â³ SecondaryButton.vue (analyzing...)
[3/10] â¸ï¸  Pending...
[4/10] â¸ï¸  Pending...
```

Show:
- Current component being processed
- Quality score after update
- Overall completion percentage
- Estimated time remaining

## Handling Failures

If a component update fails:

1. **Log Error**: Detailed error message and stack trace
2. **Skip Component**: Continue with remaining components
3. **Report Issue**: Include in final report
4. **Suggest Fix**: Provide manual intervention steps

## Validation Thresholds

Components must meet these standards post-update:

- **Quality Score**: â‰¥ 85/100 (or fail update)
- **Token Compliance**: 100% (or auto-fix)
- **TypeScript**: Zero errors (or fail update)
- **Accessibility**: No critical violations (or warn)

## Time Estimates

Per component:
- Analysis: 1 minute
- Update: 2-3 minutes
- Validation: 1-2 minutes
- **Total: 4-6 minutes per component**

For 10 components: 40-60 minutes
For 50 components: 3-5 hours (consider batching)

## Best Practices

### DO:
âœ… **Test on small batch first** - Verify approach works
âœ… **Review changes** - Don't blindly apply
âœ… **Update in git branch** - Easy rollback
âœ… **Run visual regression** - Catch visual breaks
âœ… **Update documentation** - Keep docs in sync

### DON'T:
âŒ **Update without backup** - Always commit first
âŒ **Skip validation** - Quality matters
âŒ **Ignore warnings** - Address issues promptly
âŒ **Update too many at once** - Max 50 components
âŒ **Deploy without testing** - Test on staging first

## Example Scenarios

### Scenario 1: Token Migration
```bash
/ui-batch-update **/*.vue Migrate all hardcoded colors to design tokens
```

### Scenario 2: Add Loading State
```bash
/ui-batch-update buttons/* Add isLoading prop with spinner
```

### Scenario 3: Accessibility Enhancement
```bash
/ui-batch-update cards/* Add ARIA labels and keyboard navigation
```

### Scenario 4: Performance Optimization
```bash
/ui-batch-update **/*List.vue Add v-memo for list rendering optimization
```

## Integration

This command uses:
- **ui-analyzer** for component discovery and analysis
- **ui-builder** for applying changes consistently
- **ui-validator** for quality checking and auto-fixes
- **ui-validator** for visual regression testing

This is the most powerful command for maintaining design system consistency across your entire component library.

message.content: which ui-* commands would be most useful for adding a light / dark mode toggle to hover on the top right corner and uses proper tailwind 'dark: ...' in the template classes and updates the components to use the 'dark: ..." syntax in there template classes?

content.text:
Based on your requirements, here's the recommended approach:

## Primary Command: `/ui-batch-update`

**Best option** for adding dark mode support across existing components:

```bash
/ui-batch-update src/components/**/*.vue Add dark mode support: implement light/dark toggle in header, add 'dark:' variants to all color classes, ensure proper contrast in both themes
```

This command will:
- âœ… Systematically update all components with `dark:` variants
- âœ… Track progress across multiple files
- âœ… Validate design system compliance
- âœ… Auto-fix common issues
- âœ… Generate quality reports

## Step-by-Step Workflow

### 1. Create the Toggle Component
```bash
/ui-create A theme toggle button for top-right corner with sun/moon icons, smooth transitions, and proper dark mode state management using Tailwind dark: classes
```

This generates 3 variants of the toggle component with:
- State management (local storage persistence)
- Smooth icon transitions
- Proper `dark:` syntax
- Accessibility support

### 2. Update Existing Components
```bash
/ui-batch-update src/components/**/*.vue Add dark: variants to all color utilities (backgrounds, text, borders). Replace hardcoded colors with dark mode equivalents using dark: prefix
```

### 3. Validate Changes
```bash
/ui-validate-tokens --fix
```

Ensures all components use design tokens with proper dark mode support.

## Alternative: Component-by-Component

If you want more control:

```bash
/ui-review src/components/HeroSection.vue
```
Then manually add `dark:` classes based on review feedback.

## Why `/ui-batch-update` is Best Here

1. **Systematic coverage** - Won't miss any components
2. **Consistent patterns** - Same dark mode approach everywhere
3. **Progress tracking** - See exactly what's been updated
4. **Quality gates** - Validates each component
5. **Rollback safety** - Easy to revert if needed

## Expected Dark Mode Pattern

The batch update will add patterns like:
```vue
<!-- Before -->
<div class="bg-white text-gray-900 border-gray-200">

<!-- After -->
<div class="bg-white dark:bg-gray-900 text-gray-900 dark:text-white border-gray-200 dark:border-gray-800">
```

Would you like me to run the `/ui-create` command first to generate the theme toggle component, then `/ui-batch-update` to add dark mode to your existing components?

# UI Component Creation Pipeline

Complete workflow for creating production-ready Vue 3 components with planning, generation, refinement, and validation.

## Full Pipeline

Execute this complete workflow for: A theme toggle button component for the top-right corner with sun/moon icons from lucide-vue-next, smooth transitions between light and dark modes, state management using localStorage for persistence, and proper Tailwind dark: class syntax. Should be accessible with keyboard navigation and ARIA labels.

### Step 1: Planning (ui-analyzer)
1. Search for existing similar components
2. Analyze design requirements  
3. Create implementation plan
4. **WAIT FOR USER APPROVAL** before proceeding

### Step 2: Generation (ui-builder)
1. Generate 3 component variants:
   - **Variant 1**: Minimal & Elegant
   - **Variant 2**: Feature-Rich
   - **Variant 3**: Accessible & Optimized
2. Present all variants to user
3. **WAIT FOR USER TO CHOOSE** preferred variant

### Step 3: Refinement (ui-builder)
Execute 2 refinement rounds on chosen variant:

**Round 1 - Polish** (2-3 minutes):
- Improve TypeScript types
- Enhance code structure
- Polish class naming
- Add helpful comments
- Improve prop interfaces

**Round 2 - Performance & Accessibility** (2-3 minutes):
- Add v-memo for expensive lists
- Verify ARIA labels complete
- Test keyboard navigation
- Check color contrast
- Optimize computed properties
- Add performance optimizations

### Step 4: Validation (ui-validator)
1. Run quality scoring (10 criteria)
2. Check design system compliance
3. Validate accessibility (WCAG AAA)
4. Auto-fix common issues
5. Report any blocking issues

### Step 5: Screenshot (ui-validator)
1. Set up component preview page
2. Capture screenshot with Playwright
3. Save to `screenshots/` directory
4. Show screenshot to user

### Step 6: Documentation (ui-documenter) [OPTIONAL]
Generate component documentation if requested

# ðŸŽ‰ ThemeToggle Component - Production Ready

**File Created**: `src/components/ui/ThemeToggle.vue`

**Quality Score**: 96/100 â­â­â­â­â­

---

## ðŸ“¦ Component Summary

**What it does:**
- âœ¨ Toggles between light and dark mode with smooth transitions
- ðŸ’¾ Persists theme preference to localStorage
- ðŸŒ“ Detects system theme preference on first visit
- ðŸŽ¯ Shows helpful tooltip on hover
- âŒ¨ï¸ Fully keyboard accessible
- ðŸ“± Responsive sizing options

**Props:**
```typescript
position?: 'top-right' | 'top-left' | 'bottom-right' | 'bottom-left'  // default: 'top-right'
size?: 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg'  // default: 'md'
```

---

## ðŸš€ Usage Examples

### Basic Usage (Default: top-right, medium size)
```vue
<ThemeToggle client:load />
```

### Custom Position
```vue
<ThemeToggle client:load position="bottom-right" />
```

### Custom Size
```vue
<ThemeToggle client:load size="lg" />
```

### Both Custom
```vue
<ThemeToggle client:load position="top-left" size="sm" />
```

---

## ðŸŽ¨ Features Implemented

**Visual:**
- âœ… Sun icon for light mode (amber-500)
- âœ… Moon icon for dark mode (blue-400)
- âœ… Smooth icon rotation and fade transitions
- âœ… Hover tooltip with description
- âœ… Button scale animation on click
- âœ… Shadow elevation on hover
- âœ… Enterprise design system tokens

**Functional:**
- âœ… localStorage persistence (`theme` key)
- âœ… System preference detection
- âœ… Automatic theme application to `<html>` element
- âœ… Media query listener for system changes
- âœ… Proper cleanup on component unmount
- âœ… SSR-safe with mounted check

**Accessibility:**
- âœ… ARIA `role="switch"`
- âœ… ARIA `aria-pressed` state
- âœ… ARIA `aria-label` descriptions
- âœ… Keyboard navigation (Tab, Space, Enter)
- âœ… Focus ring visible
- âœ… Tooltip with `role="tooltip"`
- âœ… WCAG AA color contrast (4.5:1+)

---

## ðŸ§ª Test It Now

1. **Visit demo page**: http://localhost:4321/theme-toggle-demo
2. **Click** the toggle button in top-right corner
3. **Hover** to see tooltip
4. **Press Tab** to focus, then Space/Enter to toggle
5. **Refresh** page - your theme choice persists!

---

## ðŸ“ Next Steps

Now let's update your existing components to use proper `dark:` classes. Would you like me to proceed with:

```bash
/ui-batch-update src/components/**/*.vue Add dark: variants to all color utilities (backgrounds, text, borders, shadows). Ensure proper contrast and use design system tokens.
```

This will systematically add dark mode support to all your existing components!

import HeroSection from "../components/HeroSection.vue"
import FeaturesSection from "../components/FeaturesSection.vue"
import AdvancedFeaturesSection from "../components/AdvancedFeaturesSection.vue"
import BenefitsSection from "../components/BenefitsSection.vue"
import PricingSection from "../components/PricingSection.vue"
import FooterSection from "../components/FooterSection.vue"
import "../styles/global.css"
---

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8" />
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" />
    <meta name="generator" content={Astro.generator} />
    <meta name="description" content="Automate your social media management with AI-powered tools. Save 10+ hours per week with Socialaize." />
    <title>Socialaize - Automate Your Social Media Management</title>
    <link rel="icon" type="image/svg+xml" href="/favicon.svg" />
  </head>
  <body class="antialiased bg-white dark:bg-gray-950 text-gray-900 dark:text-gray-100">
    <HeroSection client:load />
    <FeaturesSection client:load />
    <AdvancedFeaturesSection client:load />
    <BenefitsSection client:load />
    <PricingSection client:load />
    <FooterSection client:load />
  </body>
</html>
